thread.title: Evidence Suggests Santi Cazorla Won't Be Back Any Time Soon
thread.title_full: Evidence Suggests Santi Cazorla Won't Be Back Any Time Soon

title: Evidence Suggests Santi Cazorla Won't Be Back Any Time Soon
text:
Evidence Suggests Santi Cazorla Won't Be Back Any Time Soon Sun Feb 12 2017 22:29:07   22:29:07   
Of all the issues that Arsenal have faced in their attempts to catch Chelsea at the top of the table perhaps the most fatal to their chances is the injury to Santi Cazorla and that doesn't look like ending anytime soon. 
Arsenal's title challenge inevitably blows up in their own faces around this time of year and this season hasn't been anything special so far. 
They lost to Watford and Chelsea back-to-back to all but confirm that it would be 13 years since they won the league by the end of this season. 
There's still time for them to get knocked out of the FA Cup and the Champions League in the same week later this season so all is not finished yet. 
One thing that might have helped would have been the return of Santi Cazorla from injury but the Spaniard was pictured on a night out with a flip-flop, not able to put his football boot on: Pictured on a recent night out.It doesn't look like Santi Cazorla will be returning anytime soon. #AFC https://t.co/3OsRCOYAmr pic.twitter.com/fMdPTenGO4 - Ben Dinnery (@BenDinnery) February 12, 2017 Photo: Santi Cazorla spotted wearing one flip flop out in London yesterday evening. #afc pic.twitter.com/3XmB90V3z9 - Arsenal Relevant (@ArsenalRelevant) February 12, 2017 
Cazorla has only started seven games for the Gunners this season before he picked up an ankle injury in October and he's been a big miss since then. 
Arsene Wenger revealed last month that the Spaniard had to have surgery on the ankle and would be out for at least six weeks: "Santi had a little procedure and we have a meeting with the medical people to see what it was really. Certainly he will not be available in the next six weeks that is for sure." 
Watch our Arsenal what could have been XI video: 
At the time the Frenchman was optimistic that his midfielder would be back in action this season but four weeks later and things still don't look good for the 32 year old. 
What position will Arsenal finish this season? Sponsored Links
